qas.question: Who partnered with Egypt to build Suez Canal?
In what year did Egypt sell its portion of Suez Canal?
To whom did Egypt sell its interest in Suez Canal?
Who sold Egypt's portion of Suez?

context: The Suez Canal, built in partnership with the <a0_0>French<a0_0/>, was completed in 1869. Its construction led to enormous debt to European banks, and caused popular discontent because of the onerous taxation it required. In <a1_0>1875<a1_0/> <a3_0>Ismail<a3_0/> was forced to sell Egypt's share in the canal to the <a2_0>British Government<a2_0/>. Within three years this led to the imposition of British and French controllers who sat in the Egyptian cabinet, and, "with the financial power of the bondholders behind them, were the real power in the Government."
